text: Chemical structure of 2,4-dichlorophenol Dichlorophenols (DCPs) are any of several chemical compounds which are derivatives of phenol containing two chlorine atoms. There are six isomers: * 2,3-Dichlorophenol * 2,4-Dichlorophenol * 2,5-Dichlorophenol * 2,6-Dichlorophenol * 3,4-Dichlorophenol * 3,5-Dichlorophenol Dichlorophenols are used as intermediates in the manufacture of more complex chemical compounds, including the common herbicide 2,4-dichlorophenoxyacetic acid (2,4-D). ==See also== * Chlorophenol * Trichlorophenol * Pentachlorophenol ==References== Category:Chloroarenes Category:Phenols
title: Dichlorophenol
